P.title: Will Europa be the first place humanity will discover extraterrestrial life, if it is discovered before 2045?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if humanity discovers convincing evidence of life on Europa before January 1, 2045 and does so before detecting extra terrestrial life anywhere else in the universe. If extraterrestrial life is found convincingly elsewhere prior to on Europa, this question will resolve as No. If no extraterrestrial life is found before 2045, this question will be Annulled.
Note: extraterrestrial life must be (a) living currently and (b) highly unlikely to be a result of contamination by Earth spacecraft. This leaves open the possibility of life transported from Earth via other non-human-engineered means.

para_P.title: Could Europa be the initial location where humanity identifies alien life, assuming it is found before 2045?
para_P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will be answered as Yes if humanity uncovers credible evidence of life on Europa prior to January 1, 2045, and does so before discovering extraterrestrial life elsewhere in the cosmos. If convincing evidence of extraterrestrial life is obtained from another location before it is found on Europa, this question will be answered as No. If no extraterrestrial life is detected before 2045, this question will be Annulled.
Note: extraterrestrial life must be (a) currently living and (b) highly improbable to have resulted from contamination by Earth spacecraft. This allows for the possibility of life that may have been carried from Earth through other non-human-engineered methods.

Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if any exoplanet with >5% O2 atmosphere is found before January 1, 2030

Q.title: Will we find life on Mars by 2050?
Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if prominent, highly respected scientific organizations announce that humans have discovered unambiguous evidence of current or past life on Mars, independent of life that was carried from Earth to Mars via human-designed missions.
If this has not happened before January 1, 2050, this question will resolve as No

para_P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This inquiry will be considered affirmative if esteemed and reputable scientific bodies declare that clear evidence of either existing or former life on Mars has been uncovered, excluding any life that was transported from Earth to Mars through human-engineered missions.
If such evidence is not found by January 1, 2050, this inquiry will be deemed negative.

Q.title: Will there be a major famine in North Korea before 2025?
Q.body:
Resolution Criteria

Note: extraterrestrial life must be (a) living currently and (b) highly unlikely to be a result of contamination by Earth spacecraft. This leaves open the possibility of life transported from Earth via other non-human-engineered means.
(b) Prominent, highly respected scientific organizations announce that humans have discovered unambiguous evidence of current or past life on Mars, independent of life that was carried from Earth to Mars via human-designed missions. If this has not happened before January 1, 2050, this component will resolve as No.
(c) Before January 1, 2025, credible reports indicate that North Korea has suffered from a famine beginning no earlier than January 1, 2020 that has likely resulted in at least 250,000 deaths. This component will resolve as No if this does not occur.

Q_given_P.title: Given that either humanity discovers extraterrestrial life on Europa before 2045 or we find life on Mars by 2050, will there be a major famine in North Korea before 2025?
Q_given_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: 
Either (a) humanity discovers convincing evidence of life on Europa before January 1, 2045 and does so before detecting extraterrestrial life anywhere else in the universe, or (b) prominent, highly respected scientific organizations announce that humans have discovered unambiguous evidence of current or past life on Mars, independent of life that was carried from Earth to Mars via human-designed missions, before January 1, 2050. 
Then will there be a major famine in North Korea before January 1, 2025? 
Resolution criteria for the outcome: This question will resolve as Yes if before January 1, 2025, credible reports indicate that North Korea has suffered from a famine beginning no earlier than January 1, 2020 that has likely resulted in at least 250,000 deaths. The question will resolve as No if this does not occur.

Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if both of the following occur:
(a) Either humanity discovers convincing evidence of life on Europa before January 1, 2045 and does so before detecting extraterrestrial life anywhere else in the universe, or prominent scientific organizations announce that humans have discovered unambiguous evidence of current or past life on Mars, independent of life that was carried from Earth to Mars via human-designed missions, before January 1, 2050.
(b) Before January 1, 2025, credible reports indicate that North Korea has suffered from a famine beginning no earlier than January 1, 2020 that has likely resulted in at least 250,000 deaths.

Q.title: Will there be at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100?
Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve positively if, by January 1, 2100, there has been a period of at least 5 consecutive years in which the average global temperature in each year was at least 2.0 ˚C greater than the average global temperature in 1880.
(Note that 1880 isn't exactly pre-industrial, but earlier data is highly unreliable, and there should really not have been much warming by then.)
Data for resolution shall come from NASA, if possible. Note that the data in the link is normalised relative to the 1951-1980 baseline, on which 1880 stands at -0.2. Therefore, the critical value to look for with this specific NASA dataset will be 1.8 ˚C. It is likely, though, that the link will no longer be active in a few decades, so a different dataset may have to be used anyway.
The last possible set of 5 years to satisfy the requirement would be 2095-2099, so the last possible resolution date would be around mid-2100, in order to make sure that there are no uncertainties regarding the 2099 climate data

Q.title: Will there be a global thermonuclear war by 2070?
Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if there is an armed conflict before January 1, 2070 where either of the following conditions are true:
Three countries each detonate at least 10 nuclear devices of at least 10 kiloton yield outside of their own territory
Two countries each detonate at least 50 nuclear devices of at least 10 kiloton yield outside of their own territory.
These conditions are chosen to set aside a two-party regional nuclear war, say between India and Pakistan, or Israel and an adversary, or the UK and France, as disastrous as that would be.
As with many questions with a positive-resolution condition that may preclude being awarded points on Metaculus, predictors are enjoined to predict in good faith, as points will not be awarded until 2070 anyway

P_and_Q.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) US life expectancy at birth for both sexes fall below 75 years before 2040 and (b) there be at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100?
P_and_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if both of the following conditions are met:
(a) At any time between January 1, 2020 to January 1, 2040, US life expectancy at birth (average for both sexes) is less than 75 years, according to the CDC, World Health Organization, or the United Nations. An official statement by any one of those organizations is sufficient to resolve the question.
(b) By January 1, 2100, there has been a period of at least 5 consecutive years in which the average global temperature in each year was at least 2.0 ˚C greater than the average global temperature in 1880, with data sourced from NASA if possible.

P_or_Q.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) US life expectancy at birth for both sexes fall below 75 years before 2040? (b) A global thermonuclear war by 2070?
P_or_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if either of the following occurs:
(a) US life expectancy at birth (average for both sexes) falls below 75 years at any time between January 1, 2020 to January 1, 2040, according to the CDC, World Health Organization, or the United Nations. An official statement by any one of those organizations is sufficient to resolve the question.
(b) There is an armed conflict before January 1, 2070 where either of the following conditions are true:
- Three countries each detonate at least 10 nuclear devices of at least 10 kiloton yield outside of their own territory.
- Two countries each detonate at least 50 nuclear devices of at least 10 kiloton yield outside of their own territory.
These conditions are chosen to set aside a two-party regional nuclear war, say between India and Pakistan, or Israel and an adversary, or the UK and France, as disastrous as that would be.
As with many questions with a positive-resolution condition that may preclude being awarded points on Metaculus, predictors are enjoined to predict in good faith, as points will not be awarded until 2070 anyway.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following happens: (a) life expectancy in the US for both genders drops below 75 years prior to 2040? (b) a worldwide nuclear war takes place by 2070?
para_P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will be answered with Yes if either of the following takes place:
(a) The average life expectancy at birth in the US (for both genders) falls below 75 years at any point between January 1, 2020 and January 1, 2040, as reported by the CDC, World Health Organization, or the United Nations. An official announcement from any of these organizations is sufficient to resolve the question.

- Three nations each set off at least 10 nuclear weapons with a minimum yield of 10 kilotons outside their own borders.
- Two nations each set off at least 50 nuclear weapons with a minimum yield of 10 kilotons outside their own borders.
These criteria are established to exclude a two-party regional nuclear conflict, such as between India and Pakistan, or Israel and an adversary, or the UK and France, no matter how catastrophic that might be.
As with many questions that have a positive-resolution condition that may prevent the awarding of points on Metaculus, predictors are encouraged to predict in good faith, as points will not be granted until 2070 regardless.

Q.title: Will there be at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100?
Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve positively if, by January 1, 2100, there has been a period of at least 5 consecutive years in which the average global temperature in each year was at least 2.0 ˚C greater than the average global temperature in 1880.
(Note that 1880 isn't exactly pre-industrial, but earlier data is highly unreliable, and there should really not have been much warming by then.)
Data for resolution shall come from NASA, if possible. Note that the data in the link is normalised relative to the 1951-1980 baseline, on which 1880 stands at -0.2. Therefore, the critical value to look for with this specific NASA dataset will be 1.8 ˚C. It is likely, though, that the link will no longer be active in a few decades, so a different dataset may have to be used anyway.
The last possible set of 5 years to satisfy the requirement would be 2095-2099, so the last possible resolution date would be around mid-2100, in order to make sure that there are no uncertainties regarding the 2099 climate data

P.title: Will there be a "World War Three" before 2050?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if, at any time between January 1, 2019 and January 1, 2050, both of these conditions are true:
There is a military conflict involving countries representing in totality at least 30% of world GDP in PPP or 50% of world population in any year in which the conflict is ongoing.
At least 10 million people (civillians or military personnel) have been killed in the conflict.
[see edit history in the fine print]
Fine Print
PPP will may be determined from the following sources, in order of precedence:
IMF
World Bank
United Nations
CIA

Q.title: Will armed conflicts between the United States and the People's Republic of China lead to at least 100 deaths before 2050?
Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if, at any time between January 1, 2021 to January 1, 2050, either of the following occur:
There are at least three credible government sources reporting at least one exchange of weapon fire between the national military forces or law enforcement personnel of the United States and the People's Republic of China causing a total of at least 100 deaths.
There are at least three credible news reports that at least one exchange of weapon fire between the national military forces or law enforcement personnel of the United States and the People's Republic of China causing a total of at least 100 deaths.
These 100 deaths do not have to occur in the same conflict or the same year; it is sufficient for multiple separate events to reach a total of 100 deaths in this period.
This question will resolves as No otherwise.
In the context of this question, an armed conflict will be defined as a dispute that concerns a government and/or territory where the use of armed force between two parties, of which at least one is the government of a state, results in an exchange of weapon fire or detonations

P_and_Q.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Will there be a "World War Three" before 2050? (2) Will armed conflicts between the United States and the People's Republic of China lead to at least 100 deaths before 2050?
P_and_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if, at any time between January 1, 2019 and January 1, 2050, both of the following conditions are true:
1. There is a military conflict involving countries representing in totality at least 30% of world GDP in PPP or 50% of world population in any year in which the conflict is ongoing, resulting in at least 10 million people (civilians or military personnel) killed in that conflict (i.e., World War Three).
2. There are at least three credible government sources or three credible news reports confirming at least one exchange of weapon fire between the national military forces or law enforcement personnel of the United States and the People's Republic of China causing a total of at least 100 deaths, at any time between January 1, 2021 and January 1, 2050.
This question will resolve as No otherwise.

P_or_Q.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Will there be a "World War Three" before 2050? (b) Will armed conflicts between the United States and the People's Republic of China lead to at least 100 deaths before 2050?
P_or_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if either of the following occurs:
1. At any time between January 1, 2019 and January 1, 2050, there is a military conflict involving countries representing in totality at least 30% of world GDP in PPP or 50% of world population in any year in which the conflict is ongoing, and at least 10 million people (civilians or military personnel) have been killed in the conflict.
2. At any time between January 1, 2021 to January 1, 2050, either of the following occurs:
   a. There are at least three credible government sources reporting at least one exchange of weapon fire between the national military forces or law enforcement personnel of the United States and the People's Republic of China causing a total of at least 100 deaths.
   b. There are at least three credible news reports that at least one exchange of weapon fire between the national military forces or law enforcement personnel of the United States and the People's Republic of China causing a total of at least 100 deaths.
These 100 deaths do not have to occur in the same conflict or the same year; it is sufficient for multiple separate events to reach a total of 100 deaths in this period.

Q_and_not_P.title: Will both of the following occur before 2050: (a) armed conflicts between the United States and the People's Republic of China lead to at least 100 deaths, and (b) there will be no "World War Three"?
Q_and_not_P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if, at any time between January 1, 2021 to January 1, 2050, the following two conditions are met:
1. Armed conflicts between the United States and the People's Republic of China lead to at least 100 deaths, which will resolve as Yes if, at any time during this period, either of the following occur:
   - There are at least three credible government sources reporting at least one exchange of weapon fire between the national military forces or law enforcement personnel of the United States and the People's Republic of China causing a total of at least 100 deaths.
   - There are at least three credible news reports that at least one exchange of weapon fire between the national military forces or law enforcement personnel of the United States and the People's Republic of China causing a total of at least 100 deaths.
   These 100 deaths do not have to occur in the same conflict or the same year; it is sufficient for multiple separate events to reach a total of 100 deaths in this period.
   This question will resolve as No otherwise.
2. There is no "World War Three" before 2050, which will resolve as Yes if, at any time between January 1, 2019 and January 1, 2050, at least one of the following conditions is false:
   - There is not a military conflict involving countries representing in totality less than 30% of world GDP in PPP or less than 50% of world population in any year in which the conflict is ongoing.
   - Fewer than 10 million people (civilians or military personnel) have been killed in the conflict.

P_or_Q.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Will there be a "World War Three" before 2050? (b) Will armed conflicts between the United States and the People's Republic of China lead to at least 100 deaths before 2050?
P_or_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if either of the following conditions is met:
1. For the first question, at any time between January 1, 2019 and January 1, 2050, both of these conditions are true:
   - There is a military conflict involving countries representing in totality at least 30% of world GDP in PPP or 50% of world population in any year in which the conflict is ongoing.
   - At least 10 million people (civilians or military personnel) have been killed in the conflict.
2. For the second question, at any time between January 1, 2021 to January 1, 2050, either of the following occur:
   - There are at least three credible government sources reporting at least one exchange of weapon fire between the national military forces or law enforcement personnel of the United States and the People's Republic of China causing a total of at least 100 deaths.
   - There are at least three credible news reports that at least one exchange of weapon fire between the national military forces or law enforcement personnel of the United States and the People's Republic of China causing a total of at least 100 deaths.
This question will resolve as No otherwise.

Q_given_P.title: Given that there will be a "World War Three" before 2050, will armed conflicts between the United States and the People's Republic of China lead to at least 100 deaths before 2050?
Q_given_P.body:
Resolution Criteria: This question will resolve as Yes if, at any time between January 1, 2021 to January 1, 2050, either of the following occur:
1. There are at least three credible government sources reporting at least one exchange of weapon fire between the national military forces or law enforcement personnel of the United States and the People's Republic of China causing a total of at least 100 deaths.
2. There are at least three credible news reports that at least one exchange of weapon fire between the national military forces or law enforcement personnel of the United States and the People's Republic of China causing a total of at least 100 deaths.
These 100 deaths do not have to occur in the same conflict or the same year; it is sufficient for multiple separate events to reach a total of 100 deaths in this period.

P_and_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if, at any time between January 1, 2019 and January 1, 2050, both of the following conditions are true:
1. There is a military conflict involving countries representing in totality at least 30% of world GDP in PPP or 50% of world population, resulting in at least 10 million deaths.
2. At any time between January 1, 2021 and January 1, 2050, either of the following occurs regarding armed conflicts between the United States and the People's Republic of China:
   a. There are at least three credible government sources reporting at least one exchange of weapon fire causing a total of at least 100 deaths.
   b. There are at least three credible news reports of at least one exchange of weapon fire causing a total of at least 100 deaths.
This question will resolve as No otherwise.

Q.title: Will the price of water on the NQH20 hit $2,500 (2021 USD) per acre-foot by 2050?
Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve positively if the price of water hits $2500, adjusted for inflation to 2021 USD, on the NQH20 by 2050-01-01, 00:00 UTC. This question resolves negatively if the price of water does not hit $2500 by that date, and it resolves ambiguously if the NQH20 or a similar exchange doesn't continuously track California water prices up until 2050

Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve positively if both of the following conditions are met: (1) By January 1, 2100, there has been a period of at least 5 consecutive years in which the average global temperature in each year was at least 2.0 ˚C greater than the average global temperature in 1880, according to NASA data. (2) The price of water does not hit $2500, adjusted for inflation to 2021 USD, on the NQH20 by 2050-01-01, 00:00 UTC. This question resolves negatively if either condition is not met.

P_or_Q.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) The price of water on the NQH20 hit $2,500 (2021 USD) per acre-foot by 2050? (b) There be at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100?
P_or_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve positively if either of the following occurs: (a) The price of water hits $2500, adjusted for inflation to 2021 USD, on the NQH20 by 2050-01-01, 00:00 UTC. This question resolves negatively if the price of water does not hit $2500 by that date, and it resolves ambiguously if the NQH20 or a similar exchange doesn't continuously track California water prices up until 2050. (b) By January 1, 2100, there has been a period of at least 5 consecutive years in which the average global temperature in each year was at least 2.0 ˚C greater than the average global temperature in 1880. This will resolve positively if this temperature increase is observed, negatively if it is not, and with ambiguity if the necessary data is not available.

Q_given_P.title: Given that the price of water on the NQH20 hits $2,500 (2021 USD) per acre-foot by 2050, will there be at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100?
Q_given_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: The price of water hits $2500, adjusted for inflation to 2021 USD, on the NQH20 by 2050-01-01, 00:00 UTC. This question resolves negatively if the price of water does not hit $2500 by that date, and it resolves ambiguously if the NQH20 or a similar exchange doesn't continuously track California water prices up until 2050. 
Then, will there be at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100? 
This question will resolve positively if, by January 1, 2100, there has been a period of at least 5 consecutive years in which the average global temperature in each year was at least 2.0 ˚C greater than the average global temperature in 1880 (which is effectively at least 1.8 ˚C in the NASA dataset used).

P_and_Q.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) The price of water on the NQH20 hits $2,500 (2021 USD) per acre-foot by 2050, and (2) there is at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100?
P_and_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve positively if both of the following conditions are met: (1) The price of water hits $2500, adjusted for inflation to 2021 USD, on the NQH20 by 2050-01-01, 00:00 UTC, and (2) by January 1, 2100, there has been a period of at least 5 consecutive years in which the average global temperature in each year was at least 2.0 ˚C greater than the average global temperature in 1880. The data for the temperature resolution shall come from NASA, if possible.

P_and_Q.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) a "World War Three" before 2050 and (b) the price of water on the NQH20 hit $2,500 (2021 USD) per acre-foot by 2050?
P_and_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if both of the following conditions are met:
(a) There is a military conflict involving countries representing in totality at least 30% of world GDP in PPP or 50% of world population in any year in which the conflict is ongoing, and at least 10 million people (civilians or military personnel) have been killed in the conflict, at any time between January 1, 2019 and January 1, 2050.
(b) The price of water hits $2500, adjusted for inflation to 2021 USD, on the NQH20 by 2050-01-01, 00:00 UTC. This question resolves negatively if the price of water does not hit $2500 by that date, and it resolves ambiguously if the NQH20 or a similar exchange doesn't continuously track California water prices up until 2050.

Fine Print
PPP will may be determined from the following sources, in order of precedence:
IMF
World Bank
United Nations
CIA

Q.title: Will there be a major famine in North Korea before 2025?
Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes in the event that before January 1, 2025, credible reports indicate that North Korea has suffered from a famine beginning no earlier than January 1, 2020 that has likely resulted in at least 250,000 deaths. The question will resolve as No if this does not occur

(c) There are credible reports indicating that North Korea has suffered from a famine beginning no earlier than January 1, 2020 that has likely resulted in at least 250,000 deaths before January 1, 2025. The question will resolve as No if this does not occur.

para_P.title: By the year 2050, will one of the following happen: (a) a "World War Three" (b) will the cost of water on the NQH20 reach $2,500 (in 2021 USD) per acre-foot?
para_P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will be answered with Yes if at least one of the following takes place:
(a) A "World War Three" takes place before 2050. This will be considered true if, during any time from January 1, 2019 to January 1, 2050, both of the following conditions are satisfied:
- There is a military conflict involving nations that together account for at least 30% of global GDP in PPP or 50% of the global population in any year that the conflict is active.
- A minimum of 10 million individuals (either civilians or military personnel) have lost their lives in the conflict.
PPP can be sourced from the following institutions, in this order of priority:
IMF, World Bank, United Nations, CIA.
(b) The price of water reaches $2500, adjusted for inflation to 2021 USD, on the NQH20 by January 1, 2050, 00:00 UTC. This question will be answered negatively if the water price does not reach $2500 by that time, and it will be considered ambiguous if the NQH20 or a comparable exchange fails to continuously monitor California water prices until 2050.

   (b) The price of water hits $2500, adjusted for inflation to 2021 USD, on the NQH20 by 2050-01-01, 00:00 UTC.
2. A major famine occurs in North Korea before January 1, 2025, which will be true if credible reports indicate that North Korea has suffered from a famine beginning no earlier than January 1, 2020 that has likely resulted in at least 250,000 deaths. The question will resolve as No if either of these conditions is not met.

P_or_Q.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) a "World War Three" or the price of water on the NQH20 hit $2,500 (2021 USD) per acre-foot by 2050, or (b) a major famine in North Korea before 2025?

Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if both of the following are true: (1) Before January 1, 2025, credible reports indicate that North Korea has suffered from a famine beginning no earlier than January 1, 2020 that has likely resulted in at least 250,000 deaths. (2) Neither of the following occurs by 2050: (a) A "World War Three" occurs before 2050, which is defined as no military conflict involving countries representing in totality less than 30% of world GDP in PPP or less than 50% of world population in any year in which the conflict is ongoing, resulting in at least 10 million deaths; (b) The price of water on the NQH20 does not hit $2500, adjusted for inflation to 2021 USD, by January 1, 2050.

Q_given_P.title: Given that either a "World War Three" occurs or the price of water hits $2,500 by 2050, will there be a major famine in North Korea before 2025?
Q_given_P.body: Suppose the following is true: Either a "World War Three" occurs before 2050, defined by the conditions that there is a military conflict involving countries representing at least 30% of world GDP in PPP or 50% of world population, resulting in at least 10 million deaths, or the price of water on the NQH20 hits $2,500 (2021 USD) by January 1, 2050. P_and_Q.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) either a "World War Three" occurs or the price of water on the NQH20 hits $2,500 (2021 USD) per acre-foot by 2050, and (b) a major famine occurs in North Korea resulting in at least 250,000 deaths before 2025?
P_and_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if both of the following conditions are met:
